meanings.definition: A remark or action intended to make someone feel inferior or unworthy.
meanings.sent2: He always uses putdowns to make others feel bad.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's putdown was not helpful.
meanings.sent4: His constant putdowns chipped away at her self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The bully's putdowns echoed in the hallway.

meanings.definition: An act of lowering something to a lower position.
meanings.sent1: The putdown of the elevator was smooth.
meanings.sent2: The putdown of the flag signaled the end of the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The putdown of the bookshelf revealed a hidden compartment.
meanings.sent4: The putdown of the blinds darkened the room.
meanings.sent5: The putdown of the airplane wheels was gentle.

meanings.sent1: She would often putdown her classmates.
meanings.sent2: He tends to putdown others to feel superior.
meanings.sent3: He tried to putdown her cooking, but she just laughed.
meanings.sent5: The coach's constant putdowns motivated the team to prove him wrong.
